fields.description:
If instance has been running for a while, migration fails (presumably due to self-signed URLs expiring).  Relevant bits of log from destination NC are:

{code}
2014-08-15 13:19:41 DEBUG 000025769 doMigrateInstances       | [i-250352c0] proposed migration action 'prepare' (10.104.10.73 > 10.104.10.66) [creds=present]
2014-08-15 13:19:41 DEBUG 000025769 doMigrateInstances       | [i-250352c0] processing instance # 0 (10.104.10.73 > 10.104.10.66)
2014-08-15 13:19:41 ERROR 000025769 write_xml_file           | [i-250352c0] failed to write instance XML to
2014-08-15 13:19:41  INFO 000025769 doMigrateInstances       | [i-250352c0] migration destination preparing 10.104.10.73 > 10.104.10.66 [creds=present]
2014-08-15 13:19:41 DEBUG 000025769 doMigrateInstances       | [i-250352c0] authorizing migration source node 10.104.10.73
2014-08-15 13:19:41 DEBUG 000025769 authorize_migration_keys | [i-250352c0] migration key authorization command: '//usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap //usr/share/eucalyptus/authorize-migration-keys.pl -a 10.104.10.73 wr0HM5UoGMYDX6PM'

fields.summary: HVM instance migration fails several hours after instance started

comments.body: Testing the fix does not require waiting for hours -- just performing the usual migration tests -- since the fix involves no longer using the self-signed URLs during migration.
[~ssuehle], you may want to wait on verification until after [~vasya] does his last putback in this area.   There's conflicts between this fix and EUCA-10042
[~tjcramer], OK I have that ticket watched. Will push test when updated.

[~dmitrii] [~mmunn1]
I upgraded to today's 4.0.2 build using today's (10/3) imaging worker and am unable to migrate HVM or PV type instances. I'm going to reopen the ticket to debug. Hopefully something odd in my setup. Will attach nc log snippet shortly. 
Thanks!
-Matt

10.111.5.63	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CLC UFS UI]
10.111.5.154	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[RIAK]
10.111.5.156	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[RIAK]
10.111.5.157	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[OSG UFS]
10.111.5.161	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CC00 SC00]
10.111.5.162	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC00]
10.111.5.183	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CC01 SC01]
10.111.5.196	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC00]

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus-nc
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.2
Release     : 0.0.22276.64.20141002git039b884.el6

Thanks for testing HVM and PV, [~mclark]! Looking through the logs of your two NC hosts, I see the following:

* PV tests are failing because my fix is not sufficient to enable PV migration after 2 hours. (So, I am glad you waited that long!) You ran {{i-e043ff0a}} at 17:45 on {{10.111.5.162}} and then tried migrating it to {{10.111.5.196}} at 21:24. That failed when the destination NC tried using the expired self-signed URL for the EKI:
{code}
2014-10-03 21:24:10 ERROR 000026323 http_get_timeout         | server responded with HTTP code 403 for http://10.111.5.157:8773/services/objectstorage/0dd0ae-download-manifests/DM-eki-2a40f196-r-57f26115?Expires=1412394310&AWSAccessKeyId=AKIC3DGCURVXZLQ9DZVE&Signature=ApqYC8iE5cqlZMT%2Fu6AHm8xZe8o%3D
{code}
My fix involves eschewing downloads on the destination, but in this case they are, apparently unavoidable. (My comment in the code states that the EKI and ERI images must be filled in. This should be verified and, if necessary, fixed somehow, but I suggest doing that as part of another ticket. I am renaming this one to be specifically about HVM images.
* Failures of HVM image migrations are more mysterious to me. I see two attempts to migrate HVM images, both of which fail with an error from libvirt, but different one.
** When migrating {{i-e73baba4}} from {{5.196}}, the error is
{code}
2014-10-03 16:16:56 DEBUG 000005213 migrating_thread         | [i-4487fe59] connecting to remote hypervisor at 'qemu+tls://10.111.5.162/system'
2014-10-03 16:16:57  INFO 000005213 migrating_thread         | [i-4487fe59] migrating instance
2014-10-03 16:16:57 ERROR 000005213 libvirt_err_handler      | libvirt: operation failed: migration job: unexpectedly failed (code=9)
2014-10-03 16:16:57 ERROR 000005213 migrating_thread         | [i-4487fe59] cannot migrate instance, giving up and rolling back.
{code}
** When migrating {{i-e73baba4}} from {{.5.96}}, the error is
{code}
2014-10-03 16:31:23 DEBUG 000014744 migrating_thread         | [i-e73baba4] connecting to remote hypervisor at 'qemu+tls://10.111.5.162/system'
2014-10-03 16:31:23  INFO 000014744 migrating_thread         | [i-e73baba4] migrating instance
2014-10-03 16:31:24 ERROR 000014744 libvirt_err_handler      | libvirt: operation failed: migration job: unexpectedly failed (code=9)
2014-10-03 16:31:24 ERROR 000014744 migrating_thread         | [i-e73baba4] cannot migrate instance, giving up and rolling back.
{code}

I tried HVM migration with the latest 4.0.2 codebase on my QA boxes and it went successfully. So, may I ask you to retest this functionality on a fresh setup?
[~dmitrii][~mclark] Have the packages been updated and are they ready for testing?
To my knowledge, yes. Though I'd wait for [~mclark] or [~tony] to confirm.
[~ssuehle], nightly euca packages are, well, nightly and up to date. The current imaging worker image version is {{eucalyptus-imaging-worker-image-1.0.2-0.49.165}}

[~dmitrii],[~tony] are we testing this on systems that have been upgraded? I have been trying it in the PRC on a customer replication and it is still failing.

On the CLC:

2014-10-13 06:06:06  INFO 000352033 Exceptions               | Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{ClusterEndpoint.component}. Message payload is of type: MigrateInstancesType
2014-10-13 06:06:06  INFO 000352033 Exceptions               | Failed to send message MigrateInstancesType to service EucalyptusRequestQueueSync because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{ClusterEndpoint.component}. Message payload is of type: MigrateInstancesType
2014-10-13 06:06:06 DEBUG 000352067 ComputeErrorHandler      | :1413205566575:ComputeErrorHandler:MSG_REPLY:MigrateInstancesType


On the CC:

2014-10-13 06:06:06  INFO 000031666 doMigrateInstances       | preparing migration for specific instance i-b5e1a37d
2014-10-13 06:06:06 DEBUG 000031666 doMigrateInstances       | [i-b5e1a37d] found instance running on node 10.104.10.76

2014-10-13 06:06:06 DEBUG 000031666 schedule_instance_roundr | scheduler state starting at resource 0
2014-10-13 06:06:06 DEBUG 000031666 schedule_instance_roundr | scheduler state finishing at resource 0

2014-10-13 06:06:06 DEBUG 000031668 init_thread              | init=1 0x7f208611a000 0x7f2003693000 0x7f203a2f4000 0x7f203a0ee000
2014-10-13 06:06:06 DEBUG 000031668 doDescribeServices       | invoked: userId=UNSET, serviceIdsLen=1
2014-10-13 06:06:06 DEBUG 000031668 doDescribeServices       | received input serviceId[0]: cluster cc2 cc2 http://10.104.10.75:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC
2014-10-13 06:06:06 DEBUG 000031668 doDescribeServices       | internal serviceInfos type=autoscalingbackend name=10.104.10.37 partition=eucalyptus urisLen=1
2014-10-13 06:06:06 DEBUG 000031668 doDescribeServices       | internal serviceInfos     uri[0]:http://10.104.10.37:8773/services/AutoScalingBackend

[~ssuehle], have you ever migrated between those nodes before?  I ask because CPU architectures matter and in the DC we have 2 different CPU types. Could you try migrating the other way (migrate an instance on the destination node from your first attempt to the node that was the source)?
[~tony] it fails both directions, I just included these errors as a show of what is happening. These are machines I have used for migration before and know that I can migrate on them.

Tested and verified in PRC.
